department_name: San Joaquin County Environmental Health Department

grading_system.description: Unable to verify specific grading system methodology - county uses California Retail Food Code for inspections but grading details not specified

inspection_details.frequency: Routine inspections conducted, frequency not specified in verified sources
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Restaurant inspection search portal available at app.sjgov.org/restaurant-inspection/

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Not specified - appears to involve Environmental Health Dept for plan review
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: NFPA 96 standards apply - 6-month inspection requirement for commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems by licensed fire protection companies

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Health and Safety Code Division 104, Part 7 - California Retail Food Code (CalCode)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - San Joaquin County Environmental Health Department has authority over all retail food facilities in county including incorporated cities
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Local ordinances may restrict mobile food facility operations within different cities and unincorporated areas

confidence_notes: Unable to verify specific grading methodology (letter grades vs numerical scores vs pass/fail). Sources confirm California Retail Food Code compliance and county-level inspection authority, but do not detail scoring or grading system specifics.
verification_notes: Need to contact San Joaquin County Environmental Health Department directly at (209) 468-3420 to verify grading system methodology, inspection frequency schedules, and specific fire safety inspection authorities. Restaurant inspection portal exists but grading system details not accessible in search results.
